definitions.usage_note: 可数名词（指具体资格或条件时）；不可数名词（指资格/限定这一抽象概念时）。常用于工作、教育、竞赛等语境。

sentences.en: She has all the right qualifications for the job.
sentences.zh: 她具备该职位所需的一切资格。

sentences.en: Academic qualifications alone are not enough for this role.
sentences.zh: 仅有学历不足以胜任这份工作。

sentences.en: The statement was made without qualification.
sentences.zh: 该声明是毫无保留地发表的。

sentences.en: Do you meet the qualifications for the scholarship?
sentences.zh: 你符合该奖学金的申请资格吗？

sentences.en: I support the proposal without qualification.

credential.diffs: credential 侧重书面证明；qualification 更泛指能力和资格

sentences.en: He presented his credentials to the committee.
sentences.zh: 他向委员会出示了自己的资格证书。

etymology.origin: 来自 qualify（使有资格）+ -ation（名词后缀）。qualify 源自拉丁语 qualificare，由 qualis（何种） + facere（做）构成。
etymology.history: qualis 表“何种性质”，qualificare 原意为“赋予某种性质”，后引申为“使有资格”，qualification 即“资格、条件”。

qualify.translation: 使有资格；取得资格；限定

sentences.en: His experience qualifies him for the position.
sentences.zh: 他的经验使他有资格胜任该职位。

qualified.translation: 有资格的；合格的；有限制的
qualified.rule: qualify 的过去分词作形容词

sentences.en: We need a qualified engineer for this project.
sentences.zh: 这个项目我们需要一位合格的工程师。

common_mistakes.correct: qualifications for the job / job qualifications
common_mistakes.explain: 表示“职位资格”用 qualifications for the job 或 job qualifications，不用 qualification of。

mnemonics.content: qual-（何种）+ -ify（使成为）+ -ation（名词后缀）→ 使具备某种性质 → 资格。
